column4: can anyone help me with why ubuntu won't connect to the internet?
you using some kind of internet router?
it lets winxp through but not ubuntu
try bringing up the router's config page in firefox in ubuntu
i was able to bring that up
would there be settings in it that stop linux from gaining access?? (i had same probs with fedora)
as far as ubuntu is concerned your router is the internet... is your router set to port forward 80 to your windows machine?
i can't find on the modem page where it tells me about the port forwarding
what's the exact device you're pluggint eht computer into notnilC ?
notnilC:is the windows on a different partition on the same computer or is this another machine?
can you ping any outside internet sites? ("ping http://google.com" from a console)
